description: A clinical study status designating the study open to accrual.
Protocol is approved by the review board.

value: Blinded Status at SDTM Dataset Generation
description: The blinding status of the trial at the point in time when the SDTM datasets are generated.
An interruption in some or all clinical trial activities.
An interruption in clinical trial activity by the sponsor that is not in the clinical protocol, with an intention to resume the study.
An indication that a study is able to add subjects.

A business process status of a clinical study that refers to the study that started the execution of activities specified by the study protocol. The data associated with the performed study describes quantitatively and qualitatively actual observations and events occurring in the study after its approval, such as actual accrual numbers, dates of subject enrollment, etc.

A business process status of a clinical study which occurs before the study starts. A study plan on which the clinical trial is based focuses on several priority parameters that include but are not limited to the types of subjects eligible to participate in the study, targeted accrual numbers, schedules and durations of interventions, the length of the study, and the planned duration of a subject participation. These outlines are a part of a study protocol which is more a detailed and comprehensive study document.
A clinical study protocol status designating the protocol that has been withdrawn prior to the complete review.
A clinical study protocol review status designating the protocol that was deferred pending additional information or/and action(s).
A clinical study protocol review status designating the protocol that was denied the approval.
A clinical study status designating the study that stopped patient accrual; other study activities specified by the study protocol might continue.

value: Study Closed to Accrual and Treatment
description: A clinical study status designating the study that stopped further patient accrual as well as the treatment of the subjects already enrolled in the trial.
A clinical study status designating the study has been completed normally, according to the protocol. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.
Refers to the closing of a study to further enrollment.

A clinical study status designating that an order has been issued to a study sponsor to delay a proposed investigation or to suspend an ongoing one. When a proposed study is placed on clinical hold, subjects may not be given the investigational product as part of the study. When an ongoing study is placed on clinical hold, no new subjects may be recruited to the study and placed on the investigational product. Subjects already in the study have to stop receiving therapy involving the investigational agent unless the FDA specifically permits it.
A clinical study status designating the study has been stopped prematurely and will not resume. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.
A clinical study status designating the study that has been stopped prematurely: Subject enrollment never started. Study will not resume.
The discontinuation of a clinical trial prior to the planned end date.
